title: 10 Best Organic Mattresses of 2025, Tested by AD Editors
author: Nashia Baker
excerpt: The best organic mattresses are all about wool, latex, and cotton produced without the usage of common chemicals like pesticides. Here, our favorite tested ones

Each one notes that the final product meets a certain requirement for organic fibers, no matter the mattress type.In an age of long, confusing care labels, we’ve made the process simpler by testing a range of certified organic beds that merge comfortable sleep with eco-friendly production processes. We’ve put on Sleep Week for the last five years to prove it—highlighting our team’s favorite sleep must-haves for catching Z’s. Since a mattress is the core of any bedroom, we routinely test beds throughout the year by sussing out the industry’s best and sleeping on them like any reader would in their home. Our editors and contributors slept on the organic mattresses in this list for at least a month (our standard testing period) to give you their thorough reviews on how it affected their sleep.Comfort: From soft beds to mattresses designed for side sleepers, our editors pay close attention to how well they sleep on all of their beds—and this organic mattress story is no different. Our team of writers and contributors noted key callouts like firmness levels, edge support, and motion transfer to assess how easily they were able to fall and stay asleep.Materials: We prioritized beds on this list with certified organic latex, wool, and cotton. For hybrid models, we looked for steel pocketed coils as part of the build. In addition, we looked at the care labels and certifications to ensure there weren’t harmful chemicals or substances like flame retardants or fiberglass included.Temperature Regulation: Another important factor is breathability on the beds. Whether you’re a hot sleeper or just want a bed to keep you cool when summer comes around, most of the beds are naturally temperature-regulating from materials like organic latex. Plus, many offer free white-glove delivery and remove your old mattress and packaging for you, like Saatva.FAQsGreenwashing is essentially when companies overstate the sustainability of their products or incorrectly claim to have eco-friendly products and manufacturing processes without any official backing or proof. The best way to know if a brand is walking the walk is by looking for the aforementioned certifications that verify the emissions and production processes that brands use.How Do I Know If a Product Is Organic?If you’re set on an organic mattress, double check that it meets the standards below. The certifications stated across mattress brands’ sites are some of the most helpful ways to vet your next organic mattress, as these ensure they are rigorously vetted for sustainable practices. Here are key certifications to keep an eye out for.Global organic latex standard (GOLS): A third-party certification led by the Control Union, which recognizes products that include 95% organic rubber. Each manufacturer is audited yearly and must comply with social and environmental regulations.Global organic textile standard (GOTS): Another Control Union-verified standard that ensures that products are at least made of 70% certified organic fabrics, from the harvesting of raw, natural materials through the manufacturing process.Oeko-Tex Standard 100: Another third-party verification that ensures textiles are free of over 1,000 substances such as pesticides and colorants after being submitted to rigorous lab testing.GreenGuard: This standard ensures that products have been tested for Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) emissions and confirms that they emit less than the allowable limits of 500 micrograms per cubic meter.GreenGuard Gold: An even more rigorous standard signifying that a product emits less than 220 micrograms per cubic meter in VOCs. This is particularly helpful for sensitive sleepers and means the product is better suited for spaces like healthcare facilities and nurseries.
html:
The best organic mattresses follow a different approach to sourcing than regular beds, prioritizing materials that have been produced without synthetic pesticides or fertilizers, among other chemicals like flame retardants. If sustainability and wellness are top of mind for you, it’s important to read the fine print since some brands greenwash their products without ensuring that they meet official designations. To be extra clear about a product’s “organic” status, though, you can double check that they’re independently vetted by a third-party like the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) for cotton and wool or Global Organic Latex Standard (GOLS) for latex. Each one notes that the final product meets a certain requirement for organic fibers, no matter the mattress type.

In an age of long, confusing care labels, we’ve made the process simpler by testing a range of certified organic beds that merge comfortable sleep with eco-friendly production processes. Here, a selection of our favorites that will help you rest easier (for more reasons than one).

Our Top Picks for the Best Organic Mattresses:

  • Best Overall Organic Mattress: Naturepedic EOS Classic Organic Mattress, $3,499 $2,799
  • Best Latex Mattress: Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress, $2,499 $2,199
  • The Budget Pick: Earthfoam Organic Mattress, $1,299
  • To Ease Back Pain: My Green Mattress Natural Escape Organic Mattress, $1,699 $1,444
  • Best Hybrid Mattress: Avocado Green Mattress, $2,099
  • For Side Sleepers: Happsy Organic Mattress, $1,399

For consistency, all of the prices reflect a queen size in this story. However, mattress brands in this list offer sizes ranging from twin XL to California king.

The Best Organic Mattress, Overall

Naturepedic EOS Classic Organic Mattress

  • Made of organic materials
  • Customizable mattress firmness
  • Customizable foundation options
  • On the pricier side
  • Mattress came in many pieces that each require assembly
  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified, GreenGuard certified
  • Mattress type: Hybrid
  • Height: 12 inches
  • Firmness: Extra-firm, firm, cushion-firm, medium, plush options for the left and right sides
  • Warranty: 25-year warranty, 100-night trial

Naturepedic is one of our favorite organic-certified mattress brands that ships out in multiple boxes to customize the layers. The retailer started making crib mattresses over two decades ago but has since branched out into mattresses for adults, one that our commerce director Rachel Fletcher stands behind. She sleeps on the EOS classic mattress and loves that each part of it has gone through rigorous testing to ensure it’s thoughtfully produced from top to bottom. “The latex, wool, and cotton materials that make up the fill and batting are all of the highest quality and I don’t worry about inhaling toxic chemicals all night while I sleep,” she says.

Aside from the commitment to craftsmanship, Fletcher loves her mattress for its lasting comfort. “I chose the ‘cushion firm’ option, which falls right in the middle of the firmness spectrum, and it has suited me really well,” she notes. “I always thought I needed a firm mattress because I’m a side sleeper, but I recently learned that side sleepers actually need a little more give to accommodate our sleep style.”

While the mattress is a bit harder to assemble since it arrives in multiple boxes, it’s for good reason. “These mattresses are an investment, but each element can be swapped out over the years to accommodate for changes in sleep preference or wear and tear, which feels much more sustainable to me than buying an entirely new mattress on a cyclical basis,” Fletcher adds.

Best Latex Mattress

Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress

  • Temperature regulating
  • Minimal motion transfer
  • Ideal for those with back pain
  • Lifetime warranty
  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified, GOLS certified, eco-INSTITUT certified latex foam, GreenGuard Gold certified
  • Mattress type: Latex hybrid
  • Height: 12 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm
  • Warranty: Lifetime warranty, 365-night sleep trial

Hot sleepers, this latex hybrid mattress is your ticket to a cooling sleep experience. Our global editorial director and US editor in chief Amy Astley can attest to its breathable and versatile design, as she says it’s well suited for two (very) different sleepers. “My husband is 6’5 and often a back sleeper, and I am much smaller and a side sleeper,” Astley says. “We both sleep warm and appreciate the vented airflow channels, which allow for circulation and breathability.”

The airflow channels are found in the five-zone natural latex foam layer that also gives the bed added buoyancy and pressure relief. “My lower back pain disappeared soon after we started sleeping on it—that alone is mattress gold!” she adds. Last but not least, the hypoallergenic, breathable cotton cover is the finishing touch to help sleepers rest cooler and avoid the sniffles.

The Budget Pick

Earthfoam Organic Mattress

  • Made of eco-friendly materials like organic wool
  • Plush to the touch
  • Only two firmness options available
  • Low to the ground, if you prefer taller beds
  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified
  • Mattress type: Foam
  • Height: 8.5 inches
  • Firmness: Medium and firm options
  • Warranty: 10-year warranty, 100-night sleep trial

If you want to sleep on a surface so fluffy it feels like you’re resting on a bread bed, contributor Sydney Gore recommends this one. As a fan of bouncy mattresses, she was immediately drawn to Earthfoam’s signature selection of innerspring models. Unlike its peers, though, this bed is dense and required an adjustment period before Gore felt accustomed to the texture. “You won’t sink deeply into it like quicksand, but you’ll feel supported and it’s so soft,” Gore says. “I should also mention that it is a bit lower than others I’ve slept on in the past, so you’ll definitely want to add the mattress topper if you decide to purchase it.”

Made from rubber tree extracts, plus organic wool and cotton cotton, the bed is designed to be breathable and offer multiple benefits for sleepers. There are five plush layers in total, starting with a pressure-relieving base and topped off with a cool, soft wool surface.

All in all, the mattress is a great choice for those who like a plush sleep experience. “I would highly recommend it, especially if you’re interested in switching to an eco-friendly bed—it’s an amazing alternative to a regular mattress!” Gore says. “I noticed that I tossed and turned less throughout the night while snoozing on this mattress because my body locked into position once I dozed off.”

For Firmer-Leaning Sleepers

My Green Mattress Natural Escape Mattress

  • Supportive design
  • Ships in a box for streamlined delivery

White-glove delivery is not an option

  • Organic certifications: GOTS and GOLS certified organic, GreenGuard Gold certified
  • Mattress type: Innerspring
  • Height: 11 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm
  • Warranty: Free shipping and returns, 20-year warranty, 120-night sleep trial period

When contributor Kristi Kellogg was asked if she would recommend this bed to a friend, her answer was simple: “Ab-so-lutely.” This straightforward response comes after an incredibly streamlined delivery and setup process. “The mattress showed up in a box that was as tall as me, and I was able to push it into my garage without event,” she says.

The mattress itself consists of layers of organic latex and wool, plus cotton quilting, which unfurl out of the packaging into a supportive sleep surface. The medium-firm mattress is also just as comfortable as typical firm mattresses, according to Kellogg. “I feel super supported, and haven’t experienced any back pain sleeping on it,” she says. If you prefer a more pillowy experience, she also notes that My Green Mattress sells plush mattress toppers that give you an extra two inches of softness and pressure point relief.

Best for a Range of Sleepers

Avocado Green Mattress

  • It has the most organic certifications in this list
  • Boasts over 15,000 five-star reviews
  • Has a classic firm feel

The medium and plush firmness levels cost extra

  • Organic certifications: GreenGuard Gold certified, Oeko-Tex Standard 100 certified, FSC Pure Talalay latex certified, GOTS certified organic wool and cotton, climate neutral certified
  • Mattress type: Latex hybrid
  • Height: 11 inches
  • Firmness: Firm, medium, plush options
  • Warranty: 25-year warranty, one-year sleep trial

Avocado is one of the most popular mattress brands out there, and with over 15,000 five-star reviews for its flagship “Green” model, it was only a matter of time before we put it to the test ourselves. Designed for back and stomach sleepers, contributor Katy Olson has it in her space and loves that it’s “firm, but not overly firm.” While she has the standard firmness level, you can also choose between medium feel for a pillow top layer or plush for a pressure-relieving support layer. Plus, she says the high-quality materials have even helped relieve some of her nightly sneezing from allergies. It consists of GOLS-certified organic Dunlop latex, GOTS-certified organic wool and cotton, plus nearly 1,379 individually wrapped support coils. This combination is designed to target seven ergonomic zones that prop your body up while you snooze.

For Side Sleepers

Happsy Organic Mattress

  • Great for people who need more support
  • Includes four support and soft layers
  • Light alfalfa smell upon mattress unboxing, according to our tester
  • Only two firmness options offered, and may be too firm for certain types of sleepers
  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified
  • Mattress type: Hybrid
  • Height: 10 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm and plush-firm options
  • Warranty: Free shipping and returns, 20-year warranty, 120-night sleep trial

Just like the other bed-in-a-box experience noted above, Kellogg was “shocked and delighted by how easy it was to remove the rolled up, compressed mattress and then watch as it unrolled and sprung to life.” Kellogg says it’s an “undeniably firm” bed that “still has ample cushioning to keep it comfortable” for any sleeping position—especially side sleepers who could use some soft support.

She loves her Happsy bed for its use of eco-friendly materials like organic cotton and wool backed by a 100% GOTS organic certification. “Additionally, they are free of the glue and adhesives that are typically found in between a mattress’ comfort layers and coil systems.”

Birch Natural Mattress

  • Strong edge support
  • Soft yet supportive design

It has a limited lifetime warranty

  • Organic certifications: Fair Trade, GreenGuard Gold, GOLS certified
  • Mattress type: Hybrid
  • Height: 11 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm
  • Warranty: Limited lifetime warranty, 100-night sleep trial

Even stripped of its bedding, this mattress makes a great first impression on design alone. “The details in the color and materials made it stand out right out of the box,” says senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums. “It’s firm, but doesn’t feel stiff, and soft without making you sink—to me, it’s Goldilocks perfection.” For context, on a firmness scale of one to 10 on the site, it ranks at about a seven. It’s also designed with cradling comfort in mind. The mattress cover is made with organic cotton, which has a soft and stretchy design as well as a breathable feel. For those who like to sit on the side of the bed, this mattress also has two reinforced side edges for extra edge support.

Parachute Eco Mattress

  • Ample give
  • Stylish construction
  • Organic certifications: While the site doesn’t note specific certifications, the brand claimsthat the bed is made from 100% certified organic cotton, tempered steel, and pure New Zealand wool
  • Mattress type: Hybrid
  • Height: 12 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm
  • Warranty: 90-day sleep trial, 10-year warranty, and free white-glove delivery and returns

From duvet covers to sheet sets, Parachute Home is one of the best places to buy bedding for more reasons than one—starting with its mattress. Like the airy linens the brand is known for, this mattress is breathable from its internal steel pocketed coils—which contains five times as many as a standard bed. It also boasts additional layers of pure New Zealand wool and cotton. Contributor Kristen Flanagan has the bed in her space and considers it just right for her sleep preferences: Not too firm, but not too soft, good motion isolation, and very intentionally made.

Although it has a firm design, the actual feel of the mattress took Flanagan by surprise. “There is plenty of give, but you don’t sink into it or leave an imprint. My back feels very supported. The hand-tufting makes the top soft but not too mushy,” she says, adding that its balanced support converted her into a medium-firm mattress person.

Coyuchi Natural REM Mattress

Great for use with or without a box spring

  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified organic cotton and wool and GOLS certified organic latex
  • Mattress type: Hybrid
  • Height: 11 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-firm
  • Warranty: 365-night sleep trial, lifetime warranty, free shipping and returns

Senior commerce editor Nashia Baker sings this hybrid mattress’ praises for its combination of contouring comfort and support. While we’re used to resting on Coyuchi’s soft bed sheets, this mattress is great for its plush hand feel. And despite being the retailer’s first-ever mattress, the bed excels at accommodating all sleep positions, Baker says. As a self-proclaimed combination sleeper, she understands the woes of side, back, and stomach sleepers alike, but praises the blend of materials (like organic wool, latex, cotton, and coils) for keeping her cozy and propped up during sleep. “This bed has just enough give to feel comforting and support from the coils to maintain its shape, which I have a strong feeling will last for many years to come,” she affirms.

Brentwood Home Oceano Luxury Hybrid Mattress

  • Includes cushy planted-based foam
  • Strong cooling technology
  • Handcrafted in the U.S.

Less ideal for those looking for back support

  • Organic certifications: GOTS certified organic wool and cotton, CertiPUR-US certified cooling gel memory foam with BioFoam, natural silk fibers
  • Mattress type: Memory foam
  • Height: 14 inches
  • Firmness: Medium-soft
  • Warranty: 25-year warranty, one-year sleep trial

If you like soft mattresses made of memory foam, this Brentwood bed is a great pick. FAQs

Greenwashing is essentially when companies overstate the sustainability of their products or incorrectly claim to have eco-friendly products and manufacturing processes without any official backing or proof. The best way to know if a brand is walking the walk is by looking for the aforementioned certifications that verify the emissions and production processes that brands use.

How Do I Know If a Product Is Organic?

If you’re set on an organic mattress, double check that it meets the standards below. The certifications stated across mattress brands’ sites are some of the most helpful ways to vet your next organic mattress, as these ensure they are rigorously vetted for sustainable practices. Here are key certifications to keep an eye out for.

  • Global organic latex standard (GOLS): A third-party certification led by the Control Union, which recognizes products that include 95% organic rubber. Each manufacturer is audited yearly and must comply with social and environmental regulations.
  • Global organic textile standard (GOTS): Another Control Union-verified standard that ensures that products are at least made of 70% certified organic fabrics, from the harvesting of raw, natural materials through the manufacturing process.
  • Oeko-Tex Standard 100: Another third-party verification that ensures textiles are free of over 1,000 substances such as pesticides and colorants after being submitted to rigorous lab testing.
  • GreenGuard: This standard ensures that products have been tested for Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) emissions and confirms that they emit less than the allowable limits of 500 micrograms per cubic meter.
  • GreenGuard Gold: An even more rigorous standard signifying that a product emits less than 220 micrograms per cubic meter in VOCs. This is particularly helpful for sensitive sleepers and means the product is better suited for spaces like healthcare facilities and nurseries.
